com.geoloqi.android.sdk.receiver
Class LQBroadcastReceiver

java.lang.Object
  android.content.BroadcastReceiver
      com.geoloqi.android.sdk.receiver.LQBroadcastReceiver

public abstract class LQBroadcastReceiver
extends android.content.BroadcastReceiver

LQBroadcastReceiver is an abstract BroadcastReceiver implementation that can be extended by applications that wish to receive broadcast intents from the location tracker.

Copyright (c) 2011 Geoloqi Inc. All rights reserved.

Author:
Tristan Waddington

Field Detail

ACTION_TRACKER_PROFILE_CHANGED

public static final java.lang.String ACTION_TRACKER_PROFILE_CHANGED

Broadcast Action: The tracker service has switched to a new tracking profile.

The intent will have the following extra values:

  • EXTRA_OLD_PROFILE
  • EXTRA_NEW_PROFILE

See Also:
Constant Field Values

ACTION_LOCATION_CHANGED

public static final java.lang.String ACTION_LOCATION_CHANGED

Broadcast Action: The location tracker service has received a new location from its LocationManager.

The intent will have the following extra values:

  • EXTRA_LOCATION

See Also:
Constant Field Values

ACTION_LOCATION_UPLOADED

public static final java.lang.String ACTION_LOCATION_UPLOADED

Broadcast Action: The location tracker service has successfully pushed all batched location fixes to the server.

The intent will have the following extra values:

  • EXTRA_COUNT the number of fixes pushed to the server.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

ACTION_PUSH_MESSAGE_RECEIVED

public static final java.lang.String ACTION_PUSH_MESSAGE_RECEIVED

Broadcast Action: A push message was received.

The intent will have the following extra values:

  • EXTRA_DATAthe extra data included with the message.

See Also:

The new LQTracker.LQTrackerProfile.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

EXTRA_LOCATION

public static final java.lang.String EXTRA_LOCATION
The name of an extra used to define a Location. The data here will be a Location instance written to a Parcelable.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

EXTRA_COUNT

public static final java.lang.String EXTRA_COUNT
An integer representing the number of objects affected.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

public static final java.lang.String EXTRA_DATA
A Bundle containing key/value pairs of data.

onReceive

                            android.content.Intent intent)
Specified by:
onReceive in class android.content.BroadcastReceiver

getDefaultIntentFilter

public static final android.content.IntentFilter getDefaultIntentFilter()

Get a default IntentFilter that will match all actions declared by LQBroadcastReceiver. This method is intended to be used as a shortcut when registering a new broadcast receiver in your Activity classes:


   registerReceiver(receiver, LQBroadcastReceiver.getDefaultIntentFilter());

Returns:
a new IntentFilter.

onTrackerProfileChanged

public abstract void onTrackerProfileChanged(android.content.Context context,
                                             LQTracker.LQTrackerProfile oldProfile,
                                             LQTracker.LQTrackerProfile newProfile)
This method will be called when the receiver gets an Intent with the action ACTION_TRACKER_PROFILE_CHANGED.

Parameters:
context -
oldProfile - the previous tracking profile.
newProfile - the new tracking profile.

onLocationChanged

public abstract void onLocationChanged(android.content.Context context,
                                       android.location.Location location)
This method will be called when the receiver gets an Intent with the action ACTION_LOCATION_CHANGED.

Parameters:
context - The context in which the receiver is running.
location -

onLocationUploaded

public abstract void onLocationUploaded(android.content.Context context,
                                        int count)
This method will be called when the receiver gets an Intent with the action ACTION_LOCATION_UPLOADED.

Parameters:
context - The context in which the receiver is running.
count - The number of location fixes pushed.

onPushMessageReceived

public abstract void onPushMessageReceived(android.content.Context context,
                                           android.os.Bundle data)
This method will be called when the receiver gets an Intent with the action ACTION_PUSH_MESSAGE_RECEIVED.

Parameters:
context - The context in which the receiver is running.
data - The extra data included with the message.
